children.summary: Gets the target framework the test assembly was compiled against. Will be in a form like ".NETFramework,Version=v4.7.2" or ".NETCoreApp,Version=v6.0".

Public ReadOnly Property Traits As IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, IReadOnlyCollection(Of String))

children.summary: Gets the trait values associated with this test assembly. If there are none, or the framework does not support traits, this should return an empty dictionary (not null).

content.value: public string UniqueID { get; }
Public ReadOnly Property UniqueID As String

children.remarks: The unique identifier for a test assembly should be able to discriminate among test assemblies with their associated configuration file (so the same assembly with two different configuration files should have two different unique IDs). This identifier should remain stable until such time as the developer changes some fundamental part of the identity. Recompilation of the test assembly is reasonable as a stability changing event.
children.summary: Gets the unique ID for this test assembly.

summary: The default implementation of for xUnit.net v3.
